tool.name: LIMA
tool.description: Demultiplex Barcoded PacBio Data and Clip Barcodes
tool.command:
ln -s '$barcode' adapters.fa && lima #if str($lib_design) == 'same': --same #elif str($lib_design) == 'different' --different #end if $il.per_read $il.score_full_pass --max-scored-barcode-pairs $il.max_scored_barcode_pairs --max-scored-barcodes $il.max_scored_barcodes --max-scored-adapters $il.max_scored_adapters --min-passes $il.min_passes --min-length $il.min_length --max-input-length $il.max_length --bad-adapter-ratio $il.bad_adapter_ratio $il.shared_prefix --window-size-mult $br.window_size_mult --window-size-bp $br.window_size_bp --min-ref-span $br.min_ref_span --min-scoring-regions $br.min_scoring_regions --min-score $sf.min_score --min-end-score $sf.min_end_score --min-signal-increase $sf.min_signal_increase --min-score-lead $sf.min_score_lead $is.keep_tag_idx_order $is.keep_split_idx_order --match-score $ac.match_score --mismatch-penalty $ac.mismatch_penalty --deletion-penalty $ac.deletion_penalty --insertion-penalty $ac.insertion_penalty --branch-penalty $ac.branch_penalty $oc.split_bam $oc.split_bam_named --bam-handles $oc.bam_handles $oc.dump_clips $oc.dump_removed $oc.no_pbi $oc.no_bam $oc.no_reports $ss.single_side --scored-adapter-ratio $ss.scored_adapter_ratio $isq.isoseq --peek $adv.peek --guess $adv.guess --guess-min-count $adv.guess_min_count $adv.peek_guess -j \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}
'$bam' adapters.fa 'deplexed.bam' && ls -lah > output.txt && mkdir demultiplexed && mv *.bam ./demultiplexed

param.name: bam
param.label: Path to subreads bam file

param.name: barcode
param.label: Barcode fasta file

param.name: lib_design
param.label: Library Design
param.option: Only keep same barcodes in a pair in BAM output
Only keep different barcodes in a pair in BAM output

param.name: per_read
param.label: Do not tag per ZMW, but per read

param.name: score_full_pass
param.label: Only use subreads flanked by adapters for barcode identification

param.name: max_scored_barcode_pairs
param.label: Only use up to N barcode pair regions to find the barcode, 0 means use all

param.name: max_scored_barcodes
param.label: Analyze at maximum the provided number of barcodes per ZMW; 0 means deactivated

param.name: max_scored_adapters
param.label: Analyze at maximum the provided number of adapters per ZMW; 0 means deactivated

param.name: min_passes
param.label: Minimal number of full passes

param.name: min_length
param.label: Minimum sequence length after clipping

param.name: max_length
param.label: Maximum input sequence length, 0 means deactivated

param.name: bad_adapter_ratio
param.label: Maximum ratio of bad adapter

param.name: shared_prefix
param.label: Barcodes may be substrings of others

param.name: window_size_mult
param.label: The candidate region size multiplier: barcode_length * multiplier

param.name: window_size_bp
param.label: The candidate region size in bp. If set, --window-size-mult will be ignored

param.name: min_ref_span
param.label: Minimum reference span relative to the barcode length

param.name: min_scoring_regions
param.label: Minimum number of barcode regions with sufficient relative span to the barcode length

param.name: min_score
param.label: Reads below the minimum barcode score are removed from downstream analysis

param.name: min_end_score
param.label: Minimum end barcode score threshold is applied to the individual leading and trailing ends

param.name: min_signal_increase
param.label: The minimal score difference, between first and combined, required to call a barcode pair different

param.name: min_score_lead
param.label: The minimal score lead required to call a barcode pair significant

param.name: keep_tag_idx_order
param.label: Keep identified order of barcode pair indices in BC tag; CCS only.

param.name: keep_split_idx_order
param.label: Keep identified order of barcode pair indices in split BAM names; CCS only.

param.name: css
param.label: CCS mode, use optimal alignment options -A 1 -B 4 -D 3 -I 3 -X 4

param.name: match_score
param.label: Score for a sequence match

param.name: mismatch_penalty
param.label: Penalty for a mismatch

param.name: deletion_penalty
param.label: Deletions penalty

param.name: insertion_penalty
param.label: Insertion penalty

param.name: branch_penalty
param.label: Branch penalty

param.name: split_bam
param.label: Split BAM output by barcode pair

param.name: split_bam_named
param.label: Split BAM output by resolved barcode pair name

param.name: bam_handles
param.label: Maximum number of open BAM files

param.name: dump_clips
param.label: Dump clipped regions in a separate output file prefix.lima.clips

param.name: dump_removed
param.label: Dump removed records to prefix.lima.removed.bam

param.name: no_pbi
param.label: Do not generate a PBI file that is needed for SMRTLink

param.name: no_bam
param.label: Do not generate BAM output

param.name: no_reports
param.label: Do not generate reports

param.name: single_side
param.label: Assign single side barcodes by score clustering

param.name: scored_adapter_ratio
param.label: Minimum ratio of scored vs sequenced adapters

param.name: isoseq
param.label: Activate specialized IsoSeq mode

param.name: peek
param.label: Demux the first N ZMWs and return the mean score; 0 means peeking deactivated. [0]

param.name: guess
param.label: Try to guess the used barcodes, using the provided mean score threshold; 0 means guessing deactivated. [0]

param.name: guess_min_count
param.label: Minimum number of ZMWs observed to whitelist barcodes

param.name: peek_guess
param.label: Try to infer the used barcodes subset, by peeking at the first 50,000 ZMWs, whitelisting barcode pairs with more than 10 counts and mean score â‰¥ 45.

tool.help: Usage: lima [options] INPUT BARCODES OUTPUT Lima, Demultiplex Barcoded PacBio Data and Clip Barcodes
